discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Star schema , this is basic
Star Schema, straight out of the CompTIA reference materials.

D. Star schema

In a star schema, dimension tables branch out from a central fact table, forming a star-like structure. Each dimension table represents a specific aspect or attribute of the data being analyzed, while the fact table contains the primary measurements or metrics. In a star schema, there are no sub-dimension tables; instead, each dimension table directly connects to the fact table.
D. star schemas are designed to be simple with denormalized dimensions. while snowflakes further normalizes the dimension tables into other tables

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a best practice when updating a legacy data source?

discussion.content:
Creating a codebook helps in documenting any changes made to the data source, including modifications to existing fields or the addition of new fields. This documentation is essential for maintaining transparency, ensuring consistency, and facilitating communication among team members who work with the data. It provides a reference point for understanding the structure and content of the updated data source, aiding in data management and analysis processes.

So, the correct answer is:

C. Creating a codebook to document field changes

choices.B: Keeping only the most recent data
choices.A: Placing old data in new fields
choices.D: Removing the data source from production
choices.C: Creating a codebook to document field changes

discussion.content:
Data outliers are observations that deviate significantly from the rest of the data in a dataset. They can be exceptionally high or low values compared to the majority of the data points and can skew statistical analyses or models if not appropriately handled.

So, the correct answer is:

C. A datapoint that differs significantly from other observations.

choices.D: A datapoint that is above the trend line
choices.B: A datapoint that has the highest significant number of observations
choices.C: A datapoint that differs significantly from other observations
choices.A: A datapoint that is significantly close to the trend line

questions.question_text: Which of the following BEST defines a data outlier?

discussion.content:
By implementing access permissions, the analyst can ensure that each user group (management, internal users, external stakeholders) only has access to the relevant subset of data. This approach maintains data security and confidentiality while providing tailored access to information based on the user's role or affiliation.

So, the correct answer is:

A. Create access permissions so users only see data that is applicable to their user group.

choices.D: Create three separate dashboards, one for each user group.
choices.A: Create access permissions so users only see data that is applicable to their user group.
choices.C: Create an option to save an individual userâ€™s searches and filters by user ID.
choices.B: Make the dashboard interactive so users can find the data that applies to them.

questions.question_text:
An analyst needs to create a dashboard with three tiers of information: management, general public (internal users), and external stakeholders. The management team should be able to see all data, while the internal and external groups should see only subsets of that data.

Which of the following is the BEST delivery consideration for the dashboard?

A company wants to determine how its products have been selling over time. The company would like to know about the number of items sold, the category of the product, and the revenue that is generated from that product.

Which of the following tables includes all the information a business analyst would need to fulfill the request?

discussion.content: Only option A has number of items sold (Quantity), category of the product (Category), and the revenue that is generated from that product (Price).
